#Text=Wikinews interviews Brian Moore , Socialist Party USA presidential candidate
#Text=Sunday , March 30 , 2008

#Text=While nearly all cover of the 2008 Presidential election has focused on the Democratic and Republican candidates , the race for the White House also includes independents and third party candidates .
#Text=These parties represent a variety of views that may not be acknowledged by the major party platforms .

#Text=As a non-partisan news source , Wikinews has impartially reached out to these candidates , who are looking to become the 43rd person elected to serve their nation from 1600 Pennsylvania Avenue NW .
#Text=Wikinews ' own Patrick Mannion corresponded with the Socialist Party USA nominee and candidate , Brian Moore via e-mail .
#Text=Interview
#Text=Why do you want to be President ?
#Text=Because the two party political system , and our capitalistic economic system , are not addressing nor are they resolving the problems domestically nor internationally .
#Text=I believe we need candidates of courage and vision to address issues in a forthright and alternative way , and no one so far , does that through the systems and solutions that they offer .

#Text=I also want to represent the working man and woman , the common man , and the poor , and bring equality and fairness and respect to them , which does not exist now under our systems and society .
#Text=Have you ever run for political office before ?
#Text=Yes , I ran for city council and mayor in Washington in the 1980 's and 1990 's ; and I ran for the U.S. Congress and the U.S. Senate in Florida in 2002 , 2004 and 2006 respectively .
#Text=Have you ever been a member of a political party , other than the one you 're currently in ?
#Text=Yes , I was a member of the Democratic Party , the Citizens Party , the Reform Party and the Socialist Party .
#Text=I also was an Independent for a long period of time .
#Text=Have you ever campaigned for another political candidate ?

#Text=Yes , from 1967 through 1984 and in the 1990 's and early 2000 's I campaigned for congressmen , senators , governors and presidents in California , Utah , New Mexico , New Jersey , Wisconsin , Maryland and Washington .
#Text=I have collected signatures on petitions , raised money , held fundraisers , parties , meetings , signs , attended meetings , etc for two dozen candidates over a 30-year period .
#Text=I only decided to run as a candidate myself at the age of 41 , after campaigning for the first 17 years for other candidates .
#Text=After becoming a candidate in 1984 , I still campaigned for others in my off years up to 2004 .
#Text=What is your current job ?

#Text=I am semi-retired at 64 ( will be 65 in June , 2008 ) , but am presently looking for work again , despite my presidential candidacy , because my younger wife recently lost her banking job with regard to home loans and mortgages .
#Text=Since I have a graduate degree , it may be easier for me to regain employment than she , who worked her way up through the banking industry for 25 years without attending college .
